translation: zdobić, ozdabiać [literary; to add something decorative to a person or thing]
sentence: The bride's hair was adorned with white flowers.

translation: trafny [suitable or appropriate in the circumstances]
sentence: Chris’s apt comments summed up our opinions.

translation: dokuczać, nękać [to confuse, annoy, or cause problems or difficulties for someone or something]
sentence: Ever since I started playing tennis, I've been bedevilled by back pains.

translation: wojowniczy [wanting to fight or argue]
sentence: She was so belligerent that I gave up trying to explain.

translation: zostawić w spadku, zapisywać (w testamencie) [formal; to arrange for money or property to be given to somebody after your death]
sentence: Picasso bequeathed most of his paintings and sculptures to Spain and France.

translation: szowinista
sentence: They are uneducated chauvinists who think men rule in society.

translation: pajęczyna [a structure like a net of sticky silk threads made by a spider for catching insects]
sentence: Thick cobwebs hung in the dusty corners.

translation: związek [a chemical that combines two or more elements; something consisting of two or more different parts]
sentence: Salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine. Then there was his manner, a curious compound of humor and severity.

translation: skradający się, pełzający [happening, developing, or moving slowly or gradually]
sentence: We are totally against any form of creeping Socialism.

translation: wybawić [old use; to rescue someone from something bad]
sentence: Deliver us from evil.

translation: bez środków do życia [without money, food, a home, or possessions]
sentence: The floods left thousands of people destitute.

translation: środek odstraszający [something that stops people doing something because they are afraid of what will happen if they do]
sentence: They've installed a security camera as a deterrent to thieves.

translation: rozczarowany, zniechęcony [no longer satisfied with your situation, organization, belief, etc. and therefore not loyal to it]
sentence: Some disaffected members left to form a new party.

translation: niepocieszony [extremely sad and disappointed]
sentence: The players were disconsolate after losing what should have been an easy game.

translation: zasięg słuchu [the range of distance within which it is possible to be heard or to hear what someone is saying]
sentence: Wait till she's out of earshot before you say anything.

translation: plątać się, borykać się z kłopotami [to experience great difficulties or be completely unable to decide what to do or say next]
sentence: He lost the next page of his speech and floundered around for a few seconds.

translation: fuks [informal; something good that has happened that is the result of chance instead of skill or planning]
sentence: The first goal was just a fluke.

translation: drób [a bird of a type that is used to produce meat or eggs]
sentence: Domestic and wild fowl are generally abundant.

translation: przyjazny, miły [friendly and cheerful]
sentence: The teacher has a genial manner.

translation: granie pod publikę [informal; acting or speaking in a way intended to attract the good opinion of other people who are watching]
sentence: Experts criticized the program as mere grandstanding by corporations and local officials.

translation: larwa [an insect in the stage when it has just come out of its egg]
sentence: A grub looks like a short, fat worm.

translation: rąbek, brzeg, obszycie [the edge of a piece of cloth, such as the bottom edge of a skirt or dress, that is folded over and sewn so that it does not develop loose threads]
sentence: A hem is a folded and sewn piece of fabric on the edge.

translation: ohydny [extremely ugly or bad]
sentence: They've just built some hideous new apartment blocks on the seafront.

translation: ojczyzna [the country where a person was born]
sentence: Many refugees have been forced to flee their homeland.

translation: obręcz [a ring of wood, metal, or plastic]
sentence: The dogs had been trained to jump through hoops.

translation: narażać na niebezpieczeństwo [formal; to put something or someone at risk or in danger of being harmed or destroyed]
sentence: A police raid would imperil the lives of the hostages.

translation: porywczy [likely to do something suddenly, without considering the results of your actions]
sentence: He's so impetuous - why can't he think things over before he rushes into them?

translation: niezapomniany, trwały [impossible to forget or remove]
sentence: His performance of Hamlet left an indelible impression on all who saw it. The blood had left an indelible mark on her shirt.

translation: nie do przezwyciężenia [formal; (especially of a problem) so great or severe that it cannot be defeated or dealt with successfully]
sentence: Things which defeated you a short time ago are no longer insuperable.

translation: bluszcz [an evergreen plant that often grows up trees or buildings]
sentence: Ivy covered the broken walls.

translation: płat [any part of an organ that seems to be separate in some way from the rest, especially one of the parts of the brain, lungs, or liver]
sentence: The x-rays were conclusive and indicated a bad infection in the lower lobe of one lung.

translation: wielkopański, zarozumiały [used to decribe someone who behaves as if they are better than other people]
sentence: He dismissed us with a lordly gesture.

translation: lira [an ancient musical instrument consisting of a U-shaped frame with strings attached to it]
sentence: They played the lyre, but they never played the harp.

translation: niszczyć, szarpać [to destroy something by twisting it with force or tearing it into pieces so that its original form is completely changed]
sentence: My sweater got mangled in the washing machine.

translation: mruczeć, szemrać [to say something in a soft, quiet voice that is difficult to hear or understand]
sentence: He was murmuring to himself.

translation: zadraśnięcie [a small cut in a surface or an edge]
sentence: Apart from a few nicks in the varnish, the guitar is in very good condition.

translation: łajza, niezdara [old-fashioned; a stupid, rude, or awkward person, especially a man]
sentence: Watch that cup, you clumsy oaf!

translation: rozpostarty [reaching out as far as possible]
sentence: He ran up to her, his arms outstretched.

translation: obalić [to defeat or remove someone from power, using force]
sentence: They were accused of plotting to overthrow the government.

translation: bezładnie, na łeb na szyję [old-fashioned; very fast and not organized]
sentence: At the sound of the alarm bell, the customers ran pell-mell for the doors.

translation: odwieczny, wieczny [lasting a very long time, or happening repeatedly or all the time]
sentence: The film "White Christmas" is a perennial favorite.

translation: wszechobecny [formal; present or noticeable in every part of a thing or place]
sentence: A sense of social change is pervasive in her novels.

translation: pochopnie [formal; in a way that is too sudden and done without thinking]
sentence: Scientists are annoyed that the research programme has been abandoned so precipitately.

translation: wybitny, wyróżniający się [formal; more important, more successful, or of a higher standard than others]
sentence: He was the preeminent scientist of his day.

translation: gra słów [a joke that you make by using a word that has two meanings]
sentence: If I had a buck for every flat I fixed, I could retire...no pun intended.

translation: bagno, trzęsawisko [an area of soft, wet ground that you sink into if you try to walk on it; a difficult and dangerous situation]
sentence: The heavy rain soon turned the field into a quagmire. Since the coup, the country has sunk deeper into a quagmire of violence and lawlessness.

translation: codzienny, zwykły [formal; ordinary; typical of what happens every day]
sentence: Television has become part of our quotidian existence.

translation: przekaz pieniężny, przelew [formal; an amount of money that you send to someone]
sentence: She sends a small remittance home to her parents each month.

translation: spoczynek, odpoczynek [literary; a state of rest, sleep, or feeling calm]
sentence: The first rays of morning sun disturbed their repose.

translation: podobieństwo [the fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way]
sentence: There was a clear family resemblance between all the brothers.

translation: zwrot mienia, rekompensata [formal; the return of objects that were stolen or lost]
sentence: They are demanding the restitution of ancient treasures that were removed from the country in the 16th century.

translation: rurka do nurkowania [a tube that you hold in your mouth to help you breathe if you are swimming with your face underwater]
sentence: He was wearing a mask and snorkel and a diving suit.

translation: świerk
sentence: There are some groves of pine and spruce trees on the sea side of the road here.

translation: popłoch, panika [an occasion when many large animals or many people suddenly all move quickly and in an uncontrolled way, usually in the same direction at the same time, especially because of fear]
sentence: Two shoppers were injured in the stampede as shop doors opened on the first day of the sale.

translation: ropieć [(of an injury, etc.) to form or give out a thick, yellow liquid because of infection]
sentence: Suppurating wounds are also a potential source of environmental contamination with infectious bacilli.

translation: gwałtownie skręcać [(especially of a vehicle) to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid hitting someone or something]
sentence: The bus driver swerved to avoid hitting a cyclist.

translation: równoznaczny [formal; having the same bad effect as something else]
sentence: Her refusal to answer was tantamount to an admission of guilt.

translation: tandetny [looking bright and attractive but in fact cheap and of low quality]
sentence: Their ugly front garden and tacky, tawdry lights fail to reflect our village image.

translation: drażliwy, rozdrażniony [easily annoyed and not patient]
sentence: Prodi became more than a little testy when I raised the subject.

translation: po czym, zaraz, bezzwłocznie [formal; immediately after the situation mentioned; as a direct result of the situation mentioned]
sentence: The audience thereupon rose cheering to their feet.

translation: tymianek
sentence: Fresh or dried spices like oregano, basil, dill or thyme are common.

translation: grobowiec, grób [a large stone structure or underground room where someone, especially an important person, is buried]
sentence: When they opened up the tomb they found treasure beyond their wildest dreams.

translation: wywrócić, obalić [to become unsteady and fall down; to make something do this]
sentence: He brushed past, toppling her from her stool.

translation: występek, przekroczenie, postępek [formal; the act or process of breaking a law or moral rule, or an example of this]
sentence: Adolescence is a period marked by fascination with the transgression of rules.

translation: wojska [soldiers, especially in large groups]
sentence: They announced the withdrawal of 12,000 troops from the area.

translation: podszycie leśne [a mass of bushes, small trees, and plants, especially growing under the trees in a forest]
sentence: Police discovered the body hidden in thick undergrowth.

translation: żarliwy, gwałtowny [expressing strong feelings, or shown by strong feelings or great energy or force]
sentence: Despite vehement opposition from his family, he quit school and became an actor.

translation: skraj [the edge or border of something]
sentence: They set up camp on the verge of the desert.

translation: bojowy, wojowniczy [formal; often involved in and eager to start wars]
sentence: It has often been said, perhaps unfairly, that they are a warlike nation.

translation: zastąpić drogę, napaść z nienacka [to stop someone who is going somewhere, especially in order to talk to them or attack them]
sentence: I meant to leave earlier but I was waylaid on the way out of a meeting by my manager.
